sentences.english: The Soyuz spacecraft appears at the bottom left.
sentences.chinese: 聯盟號宇宙飛船出現在圖片的左下方。

sentences.english: He took his children to ride on the flying swings.
sentences.chinese: 他帶着他的孩子坐了那裏的太空飛船。

sentences.english: Covenant base ship and fleet are here en masse guarding Delta Halo.
sentences.chinese: 聖約人的基地飛船和艦隊都在這裏守衛德爾塔光暈。

sentences.english: I am going to the moon. The spaceship is arriving soon.
sentences.chinese: 我要去月球，宇宙飛船一會兒就要到了。

sentences.english: Earth Commander is working on the spaceship for Mars.
sentences.chinese: 聽着，地球司令正忙着製造火星的飛船。

sentences.english: I knew what it looked like. In time I'd make my way back into the shuttle; I'd hit the thrusters on my spaceship and return to that good soil.
sentences.chinese: 我會準時回我的宇宙飛船，打開推進器返回那片土地。

sentences.english: The second is a picture of NASA's Mercury-orbiting MESSENGER spacecraft.
sentences.chinese: 第二套是一張墨丘利信使號飛船的圖片。

sentences.english: A new type of rocket shot into the air with the spacecraft in which he traveled.
sentences.chinese: 一種新型的火箭跟他所乘的飛船一起升入空中。

sentences.english: He brainstormed hubs of all kinds, eventually coming to the concept of a spaceship.
sentences.chinese: 奇科想到了各種產品的中心，最終想到了飛船的概念。

sentences.english: Rosat (DLR)A big German spacecraft has made an uncontrolled fall from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 一架大型德國飛船失去控制，從天空中墜落下來。

sentences.english: We will have only the barebones ones we need on board to prepare for the teaching process.
sentences.chinese: 我們只需要一些骨幹人員去飛船上爲教導進程做準備。

sentences.english: Bustards are now associated with the Badger MK II for invention purposes as the BPC requirement.
sentences.chinese: 大鴇級飛船現作爲獾級藍圖II的發明要求。
我們都知道飛船登月的故事。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, the craft crashed when it was landing.
sentences.chinese: 出乎意料地，飛船在着陸的時候撞壞了。

sentences.english: When it comes to rock music, Aerosmith is my favorite band.
sentences.chinese: 提到搖滾樂，史密斯飛船是我最喜歡的樂隊。

sentences.english: The third crew member, Jing Haipeng, monitored the ship from inside the re-entry module.
sentences.chinese: 宇航員第三個成員景海鵬在飛船內部監控重返飛船。

definition: to shoot (a projectile)/to fire (a rocket)/to launch/to emit (a particle)/to discharge/emanation/emission
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to carry a passenger/(of spaceships etc) manned/also pr. [zai3 ren2]
cabin/the hold of a ship or airplane
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
